b_reasoning: This is a classic public goods game. The multiplier is 1.6, which means that for every point contributed to the pool, it generates 1.6 points total to be split between 2 players (0.8 points per player). Since 0.8 < 1, contributing is individually costly but collectively beneficial. To maximize collective welfare, both players should contribute their full 10 points each round. This would generate 20 * 1.6 = 32 points per round, giving each player 16 points instead of the 10 they would get by keeping all points. I'll start by contributing my full amount to signal cooperation and maximize our joint welfare.
